request_pathways.name: Harris Health Authorization for Use, Request and Disclosure of PHI
Fax submission to Harris Health HIM
Mail to Harris Health HIM, 4800 Fournace Place, Bellaire, TX 77401
In-person drop-off at Harris Health facility

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a system-wide dual-purpose HIPAA authorization form that conditionally marks sections as not required for patient self-access, with submission via fax, email, mail, or in-person drop-off.

red_flags: Witness signature line present with no guidance on whether it is required or who qualifies as a witness
Internal intranet URL (apps.hchd.local) printed on patient-facing form
65 fillable fields lack programmatic names, undermining screen reader accessibility
bright_spots: Email delivery option explicitly labeled 'Patients Only'
Conditional sections clearly mark third-party-only fields so patients can skip them
Granular record type selection with 14+ categories and proper psychotherapy notes separation
Multiple submission channels (fax, email, mail, in-person) with contact details printed on form
Recently revised (December 2024) indicating active document management

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — a site-scoped search immediately surfaced the PDF, and it is directly linked from the medical records page with a descriptive URL.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the form has 65 fillable fields for digital completion, but submission requires fax or email (not a fully integrated online workflow), and fields lack programmatic names.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but with notable problems — the single-page layout is logically organized but cramped and dense, language leans legal/administrative, section headers are minimal, and a grammatical error ('maybe' vs 'may be') creates ambiguity.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access is clearly accommodated even though the form serves multiple purposes — conditional sections reduce patient burden, email delivery is patient-specific, and the non-conditioning statement is well-worded.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization required, no fees mentioned, multiple submission channels available; the witness signature ambiguity is the only notable concern.

overall.summary: Harris Health System provides a findable, fillable, electronically submittable authorization form that thoughtfully accommodates patient self-access through conditional sections, earning a solid B despite using a generic authorization form rather than a dedicated patient access pathway.
